input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Demand has a direct effect on supply and price. Yield per acre has a direct effect on supply. Supply has a direct effect on price. Demand is unobserved. Method 1: We look directly at how supply correlates with price in general. Method 2: We look at this correlation case by case according to demand. To understand how supply affects price, is it more correct to use the Method 1 than Method 2?
